pageContent: Purpose of review: The paucity of randomized trials comparing curative management strategies for high-risk prostate cancer makes treatment decisions in this patient population difficult. Although in the past, high-risk patients have primarily been sent for radiation therapy due to concerns that surgery was not likely to be curative and associated with high side-effect profile, there is renewed interest in radical prostatectomy as the primary treatment for high-risk disease.
